enamel

Class VisualPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • enamel.Player
      • enamel.VisualPlayer

  • public class VisualPlayer
extends enamel.Player
    This class simulates the hardware for a device with physical Braille cells and programmable buttons.

    The constructor initializes the window and takes as arguments the number of Braille Cells and the number of buttons the simulator should display. This class also contains several methods that allow for the manipulation of the Simulator.

    The individual Braille Cells can be accessed using the getCell(int) method and the cell's index. The cells are indexed from left to right and top to bottom. Similarly, the buttons can be accessed using the getButton(int) method, and they are indexed from left to right. Both of these methods return the actual reference of the objects displayed in the frame, meaning you can then call methods from each of the object's respective classes to manipulate them. For example, you can call displayCharacter(char) on any specific cell to display a character on that cell. You can also, in a similar fashion, use the getButton(int) method to get the reference of a specific button. Then, you can call any methods specified in the JButton class on that button, such as the addActionListener() method.

    Author:
    Team 4: Yassin Mohamed, Qassim Allauddin, Derek Li, Artem Solovey., ENAMEL team: Sunjik Lee, Li Yin, Vassilios Tzerpos.

      Creates and displays a window with brailleCellNumber Braille cells and jbuttonNumber buttons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VisualPlayer

        public VisualPlayer(int brailleCellNumber,
                    int buttonNumber)
        Creates and displays a window with brailleCellNumber Braille cells and jbuttonNumber buttons. The two parameters must be positive integers.
        Parameters:
        brailleCellNumber - the number of braille cells the Simulator should have
        buttonNumber - the number of buttons the Simulator should have
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or both of the two parameters is negative or 0

    • Method Detail

      • getButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getButton(int index)
        Returns a reference to the button at the index passed as argument. The main purpose of providing this method is so the client can add actionListeners to the button. Buttons are numbered from left to right as they appear in the frame, from 0 to (bbuttonNumber-1), bbuttonNumber being the number of buttons initialized by the constructor.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the button to be returned
        Returns:
        reference to the JButton object at the index passed as argument
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is negative or equal to or bigger than buttonNumber (the number of buttons initialized)

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Refreshes the display to match the current state of the instantiated BrailleCell object. For the VisualPlayer class, this method loops through the jRadioButton array and sets the corresponding jRadioButton pins to setSelected(true) or setSelected(false), matching it with the brailleList's BrailleCell object's current state of boolean pins.
        Specified by:
        refresh in class enamel.Player

      • addSkipButtonListener

        public void addSkipButtonListener(int index,
                                  java.lang.String param,
                                  enamel.ScenarioParser sp)
        Adds an ActionListener to the JButton at the specified index of buttonList. The index must be between 0 and buttonNumber.

        The actionPerformed method requires a reference to the ScenarioParser, needed for it to call ScenarioParser.skip() method as well as have access to the userInput field. Pressing this key will skip to the specified area in the scenario file.

        Specified by:
        addSkipButtonListener in class enamel.Player
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the KeyListener to be added.
        param - the String in ScenarioParser to skip to, needed for ScenarioParser's skip(String indicator) method
        sp - the reference to the current ScenarioParser object

      • addRepeatButtonListener

        public void addRepeatButtonListener(int index,
                                    enamel.ScenarioParser sp)
        Adds an ActionListener to the JButton at the specified index of buttonList. The index must be between 0 and buttonNumber. The ActionListener requires a reference of the ScenarioParser, needed for it to call ScenarioParser.repeatText() method as well as have access to the userInput field. Pressing this key will repeat the speech of the text specified in the scenario file.
        Specified by:
        addRepeatButtonListener in class enamel.Player
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the button to add the KeyListener to
        sp - the reference to the current ScenarioParser object

      • removeButtonListener

        public void removeButtonListener(int index)
        Removes the ActionListener from the button at specified index of buttonList passed as argument. The index must be between 0 and buttonNumber.
        Specified by:
        removeButtonListener in class enamel.Player
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the KeyListener to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is negative or equal to or bigger than buttonNumber (the number of buttons initialized)
